entry.title: P2QRH / BIP-360 Update
entry.summary: The discussion revolves around the computational requirements for storing arbitrary data within an attestation structure. Contrary to the belief that incorporating arbitrary data would necessitate a significant amount of computation, such as elliptic curve grinding or hash collisions, the sender argues otherwise. They highlight that, based on their provided example, integrating arbitrary data into the attestation structure could be achieved without incurring any additional computational costs. This point suggests a perspective that challenges conventional assumptions about the efficiency and feasibility of data storage methods in certain technological frameworks. The conversation takes place within the context of the Bitcoin Development Mailing List group, indicating its relevance to topics of interest in cryptocurrency and blockchain technology development.
